publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3942 Brian Adam: Chewing Gum Disposal—That the Parliament applauds Councillor Kevin Stewart and Aberdeen City Council in their endeavours to try and get the Chancellor of the Exchequer’s agreement to introduce a levy on chewing gum manufacturers, the proceeds of which would be allocated to local authorities to clean up the mess created by those who discard their gum on our streets and pavements; notes that other local authorities are backing Councillor Stewart's original motion because cleaning up chewing gum costs millions of pounds each year, and furthermore believes that the Chancellor of the Exchequer should introduce this sensible proposal in his forthcoming budget.
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Michael Matheson*
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Kay Ullrich*

S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Robin Harper*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Colin Campbell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Richard Lochhead*, Stewart Stevenson*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3942 Brian Adam: Chewing Gum Disposal-That the Parliament applauds Councillor Kevin Stewart and Aberdeen City Council in their endeavours to try and get the Chancellor of the Exchequer's agreement to introduce a levy on chewing gum manufacturers, the proceeds of which would be allocated to local authorities to clean up the mess created by those who discard their gum on our streets and pavements; notes that other local authorities are backing Councillor Stewart's original motion because cleaning up chewing gum costs millions of pounds each year, and furthermore believes that the Chancellor of the Exchequer should introduce this sensible proposal in his forthcoming budget.Supported by: Michael Matheson, Kay Ullrich, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Colin Campbell, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Stewart Stevenson, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*, Robert Brown*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Mr John McAllion*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3942 Chewing Gum Disposal (lodged on 24 February 2003) Michael Russell*

S1M-3942 Brian Adam: Chewing Gum Disposal—That the Parliament applauds Councillor Kevin Stewart and Aberdeen City Council in their endeavours to try and get the Chancellor of the Exchequer’s agreement to introduce a levy on chewing gum manufacturers, the proceeds of which would be allocated to local authorities to clean up the mess created by those who discard their gum on our streets and pavements; notes that other local authorities are backing Councillor Stewart's original motion because cleaning up chewing gum costs millions of pounds each year, and furthermore believes that the Chancellor of the Exchequer should introduce this sensible proposal in his forthcoming budget. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Kay Ullrich, Robin Harper, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Colin Campbell, Fiona Hyslop, Richard Lochhead, Stewart Stevenson, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jamie Stone, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Mr John McAllion, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell
